intro: Centaurea citricolor, commonly known as the lemon-colored centaury, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are bright yellow with a distinctive orange center, blooming from late spring to early autumn. Centaurea citricolor is often found in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
